review_title: It's a race to the bottom
pros: Support Workers go the extra mile
cons: Every year, the SLT repeat the narrative about the tough economic climate shortly followed by a miniscule increase for front line support workers. What they don't tell you is that their approach to retaining business is so weak that they accept any price bring offered by commissioners. If they truly cared about SW's salaries they would take a tougher stance and negotiate more competently. If you want proof, just ask to see the proposals submitted to the risk panel by the SMT. Their only goal is to retain the size of their patch for credibility and to keep them in a job, there is no evidence of pushing back to give their SW's a meaningful salary.   LABS is just one example of this , 1 increase in 10 years and now the HOPS is accepting an extension with no increase and even considered a management restructure to accommodate the LA's  request, why not fight back on behalf of your staff?   Then the SLT rub salt into the wound and award all staff the same 0.9% increase, this is for those SW's on £19k and the SMT who are on £55k, directors who are on £80k and executives who are on £100k, and they wonder why the staff turnover is so high! It's an utter disgrace.

review_title: Lots of quality staff left due to poor senior management team
pros: Great local services and colleagues who really care about what they do. Some really amazing projects and success stories of recovery
cons:
Some really tough times at head office thanks to poor communication about when the CEO was standing down. We went from being a fun, open environment to something very different. Changes and restructures were constantly talked about behind closed doors and the staff were not given any insight. Once the new CEO came in there was an expectation of change which didn't happen. Lots of very talented people left over a spell of 18 months because they were worked to the bone with no reward. More frustratingly the senior management team seemed very detached from the rest of the workforce, avoiding tough questions and creating a culture of fear. 

I saw too many leaked emails, cover ups and people crying in the toilets. Wants to be seen as a friendly, corporate business but became a sham, a victim of it's own success and a place were respect was hard to come by.
